meanings.definition: A large shield used in medieval warfare.
meanings.sent1: The knight raised his pavisers to protect himself from incoming arrows.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers marched into battle, each carrying their pavisers with determination.
meanings.sent3: During the mock battle, the pavisers suddenly turned into giant cookies, causing laughter among the spectators.
meanings.sent4: Her pavisers became a fortress of safety amidst the chaos of the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The shiny pavisers gleamed in the sunlight, a formidable barrier against any attack.

meanings.definition: A person who carries or uses a pavisers.
meanings.sent1: The brave pavisers led the charge, their shields held high.
meanings.sent2: The pavisers were skilled warriors, always ready to defend their comrades.
meanings.sent3: The pavisers decided to take up knitting as a hobby, surprising everyone with their talent.
meanings.sent4: In the heat of battle, the pavisers transformed into protectors of the weak and vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: With unwavering loyalty, the pavisers stood guard, their presence reassuring to all around them.
